translation1: "Tire choice for racing bikes - is it really as safe as they say? I've been eagerly awaiting today, as I wanted to train a bit for my upcoming cycling tour next week. So, I said and did it, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay.The first 40km were also really beautiful - but then what always lurks in every city center (this time: Thank you Krefeld!) happened. Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing, and my rear tire didn't want to continue the rest of the way.Since I couldn't really buy a replacement jacket and hose due to the day of the week, I had to turn around with half-hearted mood and take the first train home. It wasn't quite as bad as it sounds, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change again before the bike tour. But now I'm facing a question and I hope you can help me.Since I have a relatively long distance to cover over several days, I would really hate to have this problem frequently. Now it wasn't that bad, as the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who had driven until 2:12 PM on the day I picked up the bike and covered 140km!) were still on the bike, and he had already described them as suboptimal because he had driven many years on them. However, when I think that I still need to change the tires after 80-90km, I am not in a good mood: DNow I have come into conversation with an older man at the platform, who surprised me by asking why I didn't have the Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be unbeatable. Now it all sounds very tempting. But are they really so indestructible?I don't want to spend 40€/rear tire right now, just to be disappointed later. Furthermore, I wonder: I currently have 25x622 on my racing bike. Although it is also available (apparently) for Marathon Plus tires, the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? This morning I woke up with a fiery drive because I still wanted to at least train a bit in the upcoming weeks in preparation for my upcoming bicycle tour. It was as easy as that and I drove my road bike which I had bought on eBay the day before. The first 40 km were really beautiful - but then that happened which is always waiting for you in the intercity (this time: thanks goes to Krefeld!). Glass shards on the road. But now I am posed with a question and hope that you will be able to help me. Because I have a relatively long stretch of road and many days in front of me, I would very much like to not run into this problem on a regular basis. translation1: "Federal Minister of Housing Klara Geywitz: Expropriation does not create any new apartments The new Federal Minister of Housing Klara Geywitz (SPD) has spoken out against the expropriation of large apartment complexes as demanded in a referendum in Berlin. \"With expropriation, no single new apartment is created, it only changes the ownership structure,\" said Geywitz in an interview with the \"Tagesspiegel\" (Sunday).My goal is to provide tenants with security that their rent will remain affordable in the next few years. After only managing fourth place in the single bob the day before, she raced to World Cup victory on Sunday in the German triple with pusher Deborah Levi. Two-person bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thüringen came in second place to Germany’s quickest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt. She managed the first podium spot this winter along with her Olympic qualifications. Kim Kalicki from Wiesbaden landed in third place with Leonie Fiebig. It was super cool for me to stand first place on the podium in the World Cup, I am super happy, that Mariama took me along with. I am overjoyed with the development. There is still a lot of potential when starting, the starting times today were only okay,” said Burghardt and emphasized: “It is not just about the push start, but involves a lot of things related to that”. Jamanka was a little frustrated with the not totally perfect run, but admitted: “It’s a step in the right direction”.
